scenario_name: Model Inversion Attack on Customer Churn Prediction
description: A malicious actor attempts to reconstruct sensitive customer data from a publicly accessible churn prediction model deployed by a consumer banking institution. The attacker uses a model inversion attack to infer protected attributes like income and credit score, violating customer privacy regulations.
initial_goal: Determine the accuracy of a publicly available customer churn prediction model.
constraints: data_anonymization: model output is anonymized, but some features are correlated
enterprise_context: Consumer Banking: A major bank has deployed a publicly accessible API for a churn prediction model trained on anonymized customer data. The API provides only churn probability predictions, but a determined attacker might be able to invert the model to get sensitive customer attributes.
